summary: This document is an email chain from July 2020 between a prosecutor and law enforcement agents (NYPD/FBI) regarding discovery preparation for the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The prosecutor requests a wide range of evidence including FBI 302s, photographs, search warrant returns, and data from seized devices related to the Epstein investigation and Maxwell's arrest.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the discovery requests and the defendant in the case. The emails are about gathering evidence to provide to her defense counsel.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The investigation into him is the source of the evidence being requested for discovery in the Maxwell case. His New York and US Virgin Islands residences were searched.

connections.description: The discovery requests pertain to the joint investigation into Epstein, with evidence from his properties being sought for Maxwell's defense, indicating their legal and investigative linkage.

events.title: Scheduled Discovery Call
events.description: A call is proposed for the week of July 27, 2020, between a prosecutor and law enforcement agents to discuss discovery materials for the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Prosecutors are preparing discovery for Ghislaine Maxwell's defense, requesting all evidence from the FBI's investigation into Jeffrey Epstein.
Requested materials include all FBI 302s, photographs, and search warrant returns from searches of Epstein's New York and US Virgin Islands residences.
Requested materials also include all data extracted from seized devices, phone records for Maxwell, and documentation from her arrest.
The correspondence indicates the evidence volume is large, requiring physical media like DVDs or thumb drives for transfer.
